body: Alright folks, heads up! CISA just added two vulnerabilities to their actively exploited list: one in Brocade Fabric OS (CVE-2025-1976) and another in Commvault Web Server (CVE-2025-3928). üí• What's the takeaway? Patch these ASAP! Seriously, don't delay, because leaving these unpatched basically rolls out the red carpet for attackers. We're talking nasty code injection possibilities with the Brocade flaw, and equally unwelcome web shell access via the Commvault issue. Definitely not something you want to deal with. üòÖ So, the big question: have you already checked if your systems are potentially exposed? Better safe than sorry! # Cybersecurity   # InfoSec   # PatchNow   # VulnerabilityManagement   # CVE
cleaned_body: Alright folks, heads up! CISA just added two vulnerabilities to their actively exploited list: one in Brocade Fabric OS and another in Commvault Web Server . What's the takeaway? Patch these ASAP! Seriously, don't delay, because leaving these unpatched basically rolls out the red carpet for attackers. We're talking nasty code injection possibilities with the Brocade flaw, and equally unwelcome web shell access via the Commvault issue. Definitely not something you want to deal with. So, the big question: have you already checked if your systems are potentially exposed? Better safe than sorry! # Cybersecurity # InfoSec # PatchNow # VulnerabilityManagement # CVE

Vulnerability analysis in Vaultwarden: CVE-2025-24364 and CVE-2025-24365 According to BI.ZONE TDR, in 2025 Vaultwarden is used by every tenth Russian company. Like any secretion of secrets, Vaultwarden is a critical service that requires increased attention of security guards. Its compromise entails many risks. Since the secrets from other internal services are stored in Vaultwarden, when hacking, the attacking will recognize them. And if the product automatically receives secrets using the API, the attacker will fall on the host with extensive network connectedness. Therefore, our vulnerabilities study group analyzed Vaultwarden. As a result, we found two vulnerabilities of a high level of danger: CVE-2025-24364 and CVE-2025-24365. body: Whoa, heads up cybersecurity folks! There's a particularly nasty bug making the rounds: **CVE-2025-32433** in Erlang/OTP SSH. And yes, it scored a perfect CVSS 10.0 ü§Ø. We're talking potential **unauthorized remote code execution** here. Basically, an attacker can sneak SSH messages through *before* any authentication even happens. Think about that for a second. If your SSH daemon happens to be running as root... well, that's pretty much game over for the system. This isn't just a minor issue; it impacts *anyone* using the Erlang/OTP SSH implementation. **The good news?** Patches are available! You'll want to update to one of these versions ASAP: *   OTP-27.3.3 *   OTP-26.2.5.11 *   OTP-25.3.2.20 Speaking as a pentester, gotta say, that's a clever (and worrying!) vulnerability path üòâ. Another thing to keep in mind: your typical automated vulnerability scanners might completely miss this one due to the pre-auth nature. So, what's your take? Have any of you run into this yet or started testing for it? Curious to know what tools you're finding effective for detection or exploitation testing! Let's discuss üëá # CVE   # CyberSecurity   # Erlang   # OTP   # SSH   # Vulnerability   # RCE   # PatchNow   # InfoSec   # Pentesting
cleaned_body: Whoa, heads up cybersecurity folks! There's a particularly nasty bug making the rounds: CVE-2025-32433 in Erlang/OTP SSH. And yes, it scored a perfect CVSS 10.0 . We're talking potential unauthorized remote code execution here. Basically, an attacker can sneak SSH messages through before any authentication even happens. Think about that for a second. If your SSH daemon happens to be running as root... well, that's pretty much game over for the system. This isn't just a minor issue; it impacts anyone using the Erlang/OTP SSH implementation. The good news? Patches are available! You'll want to update to one of these versions ASAP: OTP-27.3.3 OTP-26.2.5.11 OTP-25.3.2.20 Speaking as a pentester, gotta say, that's a clever vulnerability path . Another thing to keep in mind: your typical automated vulnerability scanners might completely miss this one due to the pre-auth nature. So, what's your take? body: CVE-2025-24054 - Exploited in the wild This is quite an interesting vulnerability with CVSS 6.5 and EPSS 0.6% it would fly under the radar for most companies. But it has already been used to target government agencies, requires almost no interaction from users (drag and drop, right click or simply navigating to a directory) and can leak user credentials. I know its Friday but you should patch now!    # CVE   # exploit   # cybersecurity   # threatintel https:// research.checkpoint.com/2025/c ve-2025-24054-ntlm-exploit-in-the-wild/

body: # OT   # Advisory  VDE-2025-007 WAGO: Year 2038 problem The Year 2038 Problem affects systems using a 32-bit integer to represent time as the number of seconds since January 1, 1970. On January 19, 2038, at 03:14:07 UTC, the time value will exceed the maximum for a 32-bit integer, causing an overflow and resetting it to a negative number. # CVE  CVE-2025-0101 https:// certvde.com/en/advisories/VDE- 2025-007 # CSAF   https:// wago.csaf-tp.certvde.com/.well -known/csaf/white/2025/vde-2025-007.json

body: Program CVE traci finansowanie ‚Äì zagro≈ºone globalne bezpiecze≈Ñstwo cyfrowe MITRE Corporation, organizacja non-profit odpowiedzialna za¬†program Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE), potwierdzi≈Ça, ≈ºe¬†kontrakt na¬†jego rozw√≥j, obs≈Çugƒô i¬†modernizacjƒô wygasa 16 kwietnia 2025¬†r. Tak, dzi≈õ. Program CVE, stanowiƒÖcy globalny standard identyfikacji i¬†≈õledzenia publicznie ujawnionych luk w¬†zabezpieczeniach oprogramowania, jest wykorzystywany przez¬†firmy takie jak Microsoft, Google, Apple, Intel czy¬†AMD. MITRE otrzymywa≈Ço ≈õrodki na¬†program CVE od¬†Departamentu Bezpiecze≈Ñstwa Krajowego USA (DHS) oraz¬†Agencji Cyberbezpiecze≈Ñstwa i¬†Bezpiecze≈Ñstwa Infrastruktury (CISA). Yosry Barsoum, wiceprezes MITRE, o≈õwiadczy≈Ç, ≈ºe¬†organizacja pozostaje zaanga≈ºowana w¬†utrzymanie programu jako globalnego zasobu, a¬†rzƒÖd USA podejmuje wysi≈Çki, by¬†wspieraƒá jej rolƒô. Jednak wyga≈õniƒôcie kontraktu, o¬†czym jako pierwszy informowa≈Ç wyciek listu do¬†cz≈Çonk√≥w zarzƒÖdu CVE opublikowany na¬†platformach X¬†i¬†Bluesky, budzi obawy o¬†przysz≈Ço≈õƒá programu. I¬†≈ºeby≈õmy zdali sobie sprawƒô z¬†powagi sytuacji: program CVE, czyli Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures, to¬†miƒôdzynarodowy system s≈Çu≈ºƒÖcy do¬†identyfikacji, katalogowania i¬†publicznego ujawniania luk w¬†zabezpieczeniach oprogramowania oraz¬†system√≥w informatycznych. Jego celem jest zapewnienie standardowego sposobu opisywania i¬†≈õledzenia podatno≈õci, co¬†umo≈ºliwia firmom, badaczom i¬†specjalistom ds.¬†cyberbezpiecze≈Ñstwa szybkie rozpoznawanie zagro≈ºe≈Ñ, ocenƒô ich powagi oraz¬†priorytetyzacjƒô dzia≈Ça≈Ñ naprawczych. Program jest zarzƒÖdzany przez¬†MITRE Corporation, organizacjƒô non-profit, przy wsparciu finansowym, miƒôdzy innymi, Departamentu Bezpiecze≈Ñstwa Krajowego USA (DHS). Ka≈ºda luka zg≈Çoszona w¬†ramach programu otrzymuje unikalny identyfikator CVE w¬†formacie ‚ÄûCVE-rok-numer‚Äù (np.¬†CVE-2025-12345), co¬†pozwala na¬†jej jednoznacznƒÖ identyfikacjƒô w¬†globalnych bazach danych. Rekordy CVE zawierajƒÖ opis podatno≈õci, jej potencjalny wp≈Çyw oraz, w¬†miarƒô mo≈ºliwo≈õci, odniesienia do¬†poprawek lub ≈õrodk√≥w zaradczych. System jest wykorzystywany przez¬†najwiƒôksze firmy technologiczne, takie jak Microsoft, Google, Apple, Intel czy¬†AMD, a¬†tak≈ºe organizacje rzƒÖdowe i¬†niezale≈ºnych badaczy. Czy¬†rozumiecie co¬†oznacza wy≈ÇƒÖczenie tej¬†bazy (i¬†jej regularnej aktualizacji) z¬†powodu braku finansowania? ¬† üö® The CVE program is about to¬†go¬†dark. MITRE just confirmed their funding to¬†run CVE and CWE expires tomorrow. That‚Äôs the main database the world relies on¬†to¬†track known vulnerabilities in¬†software. Yes, the CVE. The backbone of the entire vuln ecosystem. No¬†CVEs = no¬†shared‚Ä¶  pic.twitter.com/4bwcPxiA1V ‚Äî Feross (@feross)  April 15, 2025 Co¬†prawda MITRE zapewnia, ≈ºe¬†historyczne rekordy CVE pozostanƒÖ dostƒôpne na¬†stronie GitHub, ale¬†to¬†stanowi jednocze≈õnie kolejnƒÖ sugestiƒô, ≈ºe¬†w¬†przypadku braku nowego finansowania nowe luki mogƒÖ nie¬†byƒá katalogowane. W¬†prace nad¬†CVE zaanga≈ºowanych jest ponad 400 organizacji, takich jak Google, Apple czy¬†Microsoft, kt√≥re pe≈ÇniƒÖ rolƒô CVE Numbering Authorities (CNA) i¬†wydajƒÖ identyfikatory CVE, co¬†mo≈ºe czƒô≈õciowo z≈Çagodziƒá skutki braku finansowania.¬†Szczeg√≥≈Çy dotyczƒÖce potencjalnych nowych ≈∫r√≥de≈Ç finansowania lub wp≈Çywu na¬†bie≈ºƒÖce operacje programu nie¬†zosta≈Çy podane, ale¬†sytuacja jest monitorowana przez¬†spo≈Çeczno≈õƒá cyberbezpiecze≈Ñstwa. Bardzo mo≈ºliwe, ≈ºe¬†ten ruch ameryka≈Ñskiej administracji ma¬†na¬†celu wymuszenie finansowania kwestii cyberbezpiecze≈Ñstwa przez¬†podmioty, kt√≥re powinny byƒá najbardziej zainteresowane niezawodno≈õciƒÖ w≈Çasnych rozwiƒÖza≈Ñ, czyli du≈ºych, technologicznych graczy. Jest jednak i¬†minus takiego podej≈õcia: wybrane firmy mogƒÖ nie¬†byƒá zainteresowane publikowaniem informacji na¬†temat luk we¬†w≈Çasnych rozwiƒÖzaniach, co¬†w¬†efekcie degraduje globalne bezpiecze≈Ñstwo. Dotychczasowa baza luk realizowana w¬†ramach programu CVE stanowi≈Ça korzy≈õƒá i¬†dla u≈ºytkownik√≥w rozwiƒÖza≈Ñ informatycznych, jak i¬†dla producent√≥w tych≈ºe. Brak finansowania programu CVE mo≈ºe zaburzyƒá ten porzƒÖdek. Jedno jest pewne: jakiekolwiek zaburzenia w¬†infrastrukturze cyberbezpiecze≈Ñstwa uradujƒÖ cyberprzestƒôpc√≥w. #CVE   #cyberbezpiecze≈Ñstwo   #MITRE   #news   #Trump
cleaned_body: The CVE program loses financing-the Mitre Corporation Global Digital Safety, Non-Profit organization responsible for the Common Vulnerabilies and Exposures program, confirmed that the contract for its development, service and modernization expires on April 16, 2025, today, today. The CVE program, which is a global standard for identifying and tracking publicly disclosed gaps in software security, is used by companies such as Microsoft, Google, Apple, Intel or AMD. Lack of further financing may threaten its functioning. Mitre received funds for the CVE program from the US National Security Department and the Infrastructure Cyber ‚Äã‚Äãsecurity and security agency. Yosry Barsoum, vice president of Mitre, said that the organization remains involved in maintaining the program as a global resource, and the US government makes efforts to support its role. However, the expiry of the contract, which was the first to inform the letter leakage to members of the CVE board published on X and BlueSky platforms, raises concerns about the future of the program. And that we would be aware of the seriousness of the situation: CVE, i.e. Common Vulnerabilies and Exposures, is an international system for identifying, cataloging and public disclosure of gaps in software security and IT systems. Its purpose is to ensure a standard way to describe and track susceptibility, which enables companies, researchers and specialists in cyber security to quickly recognize threats, assess their seriousness and prioritize repair activities. The program is managed by Mitre Corporation, a non-profit organization, with financial support, among others, the US National Security Department. Each gap reported under the program receives a unique CVE identifier in the "CVE-ROK-NUMER" format, which allows it to be clearly identified in global databases. CVE records contain a description of vulnerability, its potential impact and, as far as possible, reference to corrections or remedies. The system is used by the largest technology companies such as Microsoft, Google, Apple, Intel and AMD, as well as government organizations and independent researchers. Do you understand what this database means due to lack of financing? The Cve program is about to go dark. Mitre just confirmed their funding to run cve and cwe expires tomorrow. That‚Äôs the main database the world relies on to track know vulnerabites in software. Yes, The Cve. The backbone of the entire vuln ecosystem. No cves = no shared ... pic.twitter.com/4bwcpxia1v - Feross April 15, 2025 Although Mitre ensures that Historical CVE records will remain available on the GitHub website, but this is also another suggestion that in the absence of new financing, new gaps may not be cataloged. Over 400 organizations such as Google, Apple and Microsoft are involved in the work on CVE, which play the role of CVE Numbering Authorities and issue CVE identifiers, which can partly alleviate the effects of lack of financing. Details of potential new sources of financing or impact on current program operations have not been given, but the situation is monitored by the cyber security community. It is very possible that this movement of the American administration is aimed at forcing financing the issue of cyber security by entities that should be most interested in the reliability of their own solutions, i.e. large, technological players. However, there is also a minus of this approach: selected companies may not be interested in publishing information on gaps in their own solutions, which in effect degrade global security. The existing gap base implemented as part of the CVE program was a benefit for users of IT solutions as well as for producers. Lack of financing the CVE program can disturb this order. One thing is certain: any disorders in cybersecurity infrastructure are delighted with cybercriminals. #Cve #cyber security #mitre #News #TRUMP

body: Seriously? Another massive Windows vulnerability (CVE-2025-29824) is being actively exploited, and this time, it's paving the way for ransomware. Ugh. üò† We're looking at privilege escalation within CLFS. It seems the Storm-2460 threat actor group is getting in on the action, leveraging tools like PipeMagic, ultimately leading to RansomEXX deployment. Just great... *not*! This whole situation really hammers it home yet again: Patching isn't optional, folks ‚Äì it's absolutely essential! The same goes for implementing the Principle of Least Privilege. It's also a good time to double-check your EDR settings and seriously ramp up your auditing game. And please, keep this in mind: running automated vulnerability scans is *not* the same as a proper penetration test! You need skilled people, actual human intelligence, digging into your systems to find what scanners miss. What have you all been seeing out there? Any close calls or experiences with similar attacks lately? Let's share some intel. # infosec   # pentesting   # ransomware   # windowssecurity   # cybersecurity   # CVE
cleaned_body: Seriously? Another massive Windows vulnerability is being actively exploited, and this time, it's paving the way for ransomware. Ugh. We're looking at privilege escalation within CLFS. It seems the Storm-2460 threat actor group is getting in on the action, leveraging tools like PipeMagic, ultimately leading to RansomEXX deployment. Just great... not! This whole situation really hammers it home yet again: Patching isn't optional, folks ‚Äì it's absolutely essential! The same goes for implementing the Principle of Least Privilege. It's also a good time to double-check your EDR settings and seriously ramp up your auditing game. And please, keep this in mind: running automated vulnerability scans is not the same as a proper penetration test! You need skilled people, actual human intelligence, digging into your systems to find what scanners miss. What have you all been seeing out there? Any close calls or experiences with similar attacks lately? Let's share some intel. # infosec # pentesting # ransomware # windowssecurity # cybersecurity # CVE

body: Just another Monday in IT, right? Dealing with CrushFTP, the CISA KEV list, and active exploits... ü§Ø So, let's talk about CVE-2024-4040 (heads-up, the original post might've had a typo on the year/number!). It‚Äôs a tricky authentication bypass vulnerability. While that might sound a bit technical, the bottom line is it's seriously critical. Why? Because unauthenticated attackers could potentially log in as *any* user and basically hijack the entire system. Yikes. Now, CISA has flagged this one, adding it to their Known Exploited Vulnerabilities list. Their advice? Get patching done by April 28th! You know, this probably impacts quite a few places that might not even have it on their radar yet. üôÑ Why am I even posting about this? Well, because relying solely on automated scans often isn't enough ‚Äì they can miss things like this. This is exactly the kind of vulnerability that thorough pentesting is designed to uncover. Plus, let's be honest, your clients (or your own company!) will thank you big time for spotting and fixing these issues *before* things go boom. üòâ Here‚Äôs a quick action plan: *   Get those systems updated ASAP! *   Give your setups a thorough check. *   Time for a password reset on affected accounts. *   Make sure you've got 2FA turned on wherever possible. *   Keep a close watch on your network activity. Over to you: What are your go-to tools for hunting down vulnerabilities like this one? Drop your thoughts below! ü§î # infosec   # pentesting   # CISA   # cybersecurity   # CrushFTP   # CVE
cleaned_body: Just another Monday in IT, right? Dealing with CrushFTP, the CISA KEV list, and active exploits... So, let's talk about CVE-2024-4040 . It‚Äôs a tricky authentication bypass vulnerability. While that might sound a bit technical, the bottom line is it's seriously critical. Why? Because unauthenticated attackers could potentially log in as any user and basically hijack the entire system. Yikes. Now, CISA has flagged this one, adding it to their Known Exploited Vulnerabilities list. Their advice? Get patching done by April 28th! You know, this probably impacts quite a few places that might not even have it on their radar yet. Why am I even posting about this? Well, because relying solely on automated scans often isn't enough ‚Äì they can miss things like this. This is exactly the kind of vulnerability that thorough pentesting is designed to uncover. Plus, let's be honest, your clients will thank you big time for spotting and fixing these issues before things go boom. Here‚Äôs a quick action plan: Get those systems updated ASAP! Give your setups a thorough check. Time for a password reset on affected accounts. Make sure you've got 2FA turned on wherever possible. Keep a close watch on your network activity. Over to you: What are your go-to tools for hunting down vulnerabilities like this one? Drop your thoughts below! # infosec # pentesting # CISA # cybersecurity # CrushFTP # CVE

body: # OT   # Advisory  VDE-2025-015 CODESYS Control V3 removable media path traversal A low privileged attacker with physical access to a controller, that supports removable media and is running a CODESYS Control runtime system, can exploit the insufficient path validation by connecting removable media with a file system supporting symbolic links. This could allow the attacker to bypass SysFile restrictions and gain unauthorized access to the entire file system. # CVE  CVE-2025-0694 https:// certvde.com/en/advisories/VDE- 2025-015 # CSAF   https:// codesys.csaf-tp.certvde.com/.w ell-known/csaf/white/2025/advisory2025-03_vde-2025-015.json

body: # OT   # Advisory  VDE-2025-013 CODESYS (Edge) Gateway for Windows insecure default The CODESYS Gateway enables communication between CODESYS runtimes and other clients, primarily the CODESYS Development System V3. It is usually installed as a part of the CODESYS Development System V3 setup and accessed locally by the CODESYS Development System. Due to an insecure standard configuration of the CODESYS Gateway, it is not only accessible locally, but also remotely by default. # CVE  CVE-2024-41975 https:// certvde.com/en/advisories/VDE- 2025-013 # CSAF   https:// codesys.csaf-tp.certvde.com/.w ell-known/csaf/white/2025/advisory2025-02_vde-2025-013.json

body: # OT   # Advisory  VDE-2025-022 CODESYS Control V3 - OPC UA Server Authentication bypass The OPC UA security policy Basic128Rsa15 is vulnerable against attacks on the private key. This can lead to loss of confidentiality or authentication bypass. The CODESYS OPC UA server is not affected in the default configuration. However, the affected policy may be enabled by a customer configuration. # CVE  CVE-2025-1468 https:// certvde.com/en/advisories/VDE- 2025-022 # CSAF   https:// codesys.csaf-tp.certvde.com/.w ell-known/csaf/white/2025/advisory2025-04_vde-2025-022.json

body: ReliaQuest (ex. Digital Shadows):  https://www. reliaquest.com/blog/credential -theft-vs-admin-control-threat-spotlight/ This report examines how VPN vulnerabilities, particularly CVE-2018-13379 and CVE-2022-40684 affecting Fortinet products, remain highly exploited years after disclosure. The analysis reveals a 4,223% increase in cybercriminal forum discussions about Fortinet VPNs since 2018, highlighting their continued relevance in attack campaigns. Threat actors exploit these vulnerabilities primarily through credential theft and gaining administrative control. The report details how cybercriminals and state-sponsored APT groups leverage these vulnerabilities, with 64% of VPN vulnerabilities directly linked to ransomware campaigns. The report also examines a 2025 breach by 'Belsen_Group' that compromised over 15,000 FortiGate devices using CVE-2022-40684. The authors provide detection rules, threat hunting recommendations, and defensive strategies to mitigate these threats, while predicting increased hybrid threats targeting VPN infrastructure and the growing impact of AI on VPN exploitation. # CyberSecurity   # FortinetNot   # Fortinet   # Fortigate   # VPN   # Vulnerabilities   # CVE   # BelsenGroup

Threat actors exploit these vulnerabilities primarily through credential theft and gaining administrative control. The report details how cybercriminals and state-sponsored APT groups leverage these vulnerabilities, with 64% of VPN vulnerabilities directly linked to ransomware campaigns. The report also examines a 2025 breach by 'BelsenGroup' that compromised over 15,000 FortiGate devices using CVE-2022-40684. body: Regarding latest  # landlock   # cve  which is still under analysis,  # sydbox  prevents unknown files (and files referring to block devices) from being listed and opened, see  https:// gitlab.exherbo.org/sydbox/sydb ox/-/blob/main/src/hook.rs?ref_type=heads#L12380  and  https:// gitlab.exherbo.org/sydbox/sydb ox/-/blob/main/src/path.rs?ref_type=heads#L349 , the  # cve  is here,  https:// nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2 025-21830  So far the only false positive we had is pipewire passing files of unknown types thru unix sockets so we relaxed that but we still do disallow passing dirfds like  # openbsd  and add to that symlinkfds and blockdevfds  # exherbo   # security
cleaned_body: Regarding latest # landlock # cve which is still under analysis, # sydbox prevents unknown files from being listed and opened, see https:// gitlab.exherbo.org/sydbox/sydb ox/-/blob/main/src/hook.rs?reftype=heads#L12380 and https:// gitlab.exherbo.org/sydbox/sydb ox/-/blob/main/src/path.rs?reftype=heads#L349 , the # cve is here, https:// nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2 025-21830 So far the only false positive we had is pipewire passing files of unknown types thru unix sockets so we relaxed that but we still do disallow passing dirfds like # openbsd and add to that symlinkfds and blockdevfds # exherbo # security

body: # ESETresearch  has discovered a zero day exploit abusing  # CVE -2025-24983 vulnerability in the Windows kernel ü™ü to elevate privileges ( # LPE ). First seen in the wild in March 2023, the exploit was deployed through  # PipeMagic  backdoor on the compromised machines. The exploit targets Windows 8.1 and Server 2012 R2. The vulnerability affects OSes released before Windows 10 build 1809, including still supported Windows Server 2016. It does not affect more recent Windows OSes such as Windows 11. The vulnerability is a use after free in Win32k driver. In a certain scenario achieved using the  # WaitForInputIdle  API, the  # W32PROCESS  structure gets dereferenced one more time than it should, causing UAF. To reach the vulnerability, a race condition must be won. The patches were released today. Microsoft advisory with security update details is available here:  https:// msrc.microsoft.com/update-guid e/vulnerability/CVE-2025-24983
cleaned_body: # ESETresearch has discovered a zero day exploit abusing # CVE -2025-24983 vulnerability in the Windows kernel to elevate privileges . First seen in the wild in March 2023, the exploit was deployed through # PipeMagic backdoor on the compromised machines. The exploit targets Windows 8.1 and Server 2012 R2. The vulnerability affects OSes released before Windows 10 build 1809, including still supported Windows Server 2016. It does not affect more recent Windows OSes such as Windows 11. The vulnerability is a use after free in Win32k driver. In a certain scenario achieved using the # WaitForInputIdle API, the # W32PROCESS structure gets dereferenced one more time than it should, causing UAF. To reach the vulnerability, a race condition must be won. The patches were released today. Microsoft advisory with security update details is available here: https:// msrc.microsoft.com/update-guid e/vulnerability/CVE-2025-24983

body: A newly discovered security vulnerability in the Vim text editor, identified as CVE-2025-27423, poses a serious risk for users. This flaw, found in Vim‚Äôs (tar.vim plugin), could allow attackers to gain control of a user‚Äôs computer if a malicious TAR file is opened. Vim‚Äôs tar.vim plugin is designed to help users view and edit TAR files (a type of compressed archive) directly in the text editor. Unfortunately, a recent update introduced an issue where filenames within these TAR files were not adequately checked or "sanitized." Cybercriminals can exploit this by crafting a specially designed TAR file to execute harmful commands on a victim's computer once the file is opened in Vim. https:// github.com/vim/vim/security/ad visories/GHSA-wfmf-8626-q3r3 # cybersecurity   # vulnerability   # vim   # tar   # plugin   # cve   # code_execution   # Ry0taK

body: VMware recently addressed several serious security flaws in their products, including ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion.  CVE-2025-22224: This critical flaw allows attackers to send malicious data to the system, causing it to behave unpredictably. CVE-2025-22225: This vulnerability lets attackers write data into restricted areas of the system. By doing so, they can escape the virtual machine's sandbox (a protective barrier) and gain unauthorized access to the host system.  CVE-2025-22226: This flaw allows attackers to read sensitive information from the system's memory.  https:// blogs.vmware.com/security/ https:// support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/s upport-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/25390 # cybersecurity   # vulnerability   # cve   # vmware   # esxi   # workstation   # pro   # player   # fusion   # cloud   # heap_overflow

body: Looking at CVE-2024-53427 a bug in `jq` v1.7.1 (and earlier) which looks like a stack buffer overflow.  Since `jq` is so prevalent on the net, that's a concern. The bug was found by fuzzing and not by some one doing clever malicious analysis and there's no published exploit. https:// github.com/advisories/GHSA-8mx c-vqrq-gcm8 https:// github.com/jqlang/jq/issues/31 96 "decNumberCopy in decNumber.c in jq through 1.7.1 does not properly consider that NaN is interpreted as numeric, which has a resultant stack-based buffer overflow and out-of-bounds write, as demonstrated by use of --slurp with subtraction, such as a filter of .-. when the input has a certain form of digit string with NaN (e.g., "1 NaN123" immediately followed by many more digits)." # jq   # cve
cleaned_body: Looking at CVE-2024-53427 a bug in `jq` v1.7.1 which looks like a stack buffer overflow. Since `jq` is so prevalent on the net, that's a concern. body: GNU Emacs: new critical remote shell injection vulnerability. Red Hat discovered a command injection flaw in the text editor Emacs. It allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to execute any command on your computer. The vulnerability is activated when you visit a malicious website or link. https://www. cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025- 1244 --- # news   # software   # gnu   # emacs   # security   # hacking   # terminal   # linux   # cve   # opensource   # freesoftware   --- Mitigation: uninstall/update immediately.

For Windows and MacOS it is 133.0.6943.126/.127, for Linux 133.0.6943.126, while for Android 133.0.6943.121. Two errors with a high level of criticality CVE-2025-0999 and CVE-2025-1426 were arranged, as well as one at medium level-CVE-2025-1006. body: If you are using OpenSSH, best to patch your equipment at the next available window. CVE-2025-26465 has been fixed in 9.9p2. Supported  #OpenBSD  releases have errata up already and the portable version can can be found over on on the OpenSSH website  https://www.openssh.com/releasenotes.html#9.9p2 https://cdn.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/OpenSSH/portable/ Summary from release notes: Fix CVE-2025-26465 - ssh(1) in OpenSSH versions 6.8p1 to 9.9p1   (inclusive) contained a logic error that allowed an on-path   attacker (a.k.a MITM) to impersonate any server when the   VerifyHostKeyDNS option is enabled. This option is off by default. Fix CVE-2025-26466 - sshd(8) in OpenSSH versions 9.5p1 to 9.9p1   (inclusive) is vulnerable to a memory/CPU denial-of-service related   to the handling of SSH2_MSG_PING packets. This condition may be   mitigated using the existing PerSourcePenalties feature. #OpenSSH   #security   #CVE
cleaned_body: If you are using OpenSSH, best to patch your equipment at the next available window. CVE-2025-26465 has been fixed in 9.9p2. Supported #OpenBSD releases have errata up already and the portable version can can be found over on on the OpenSSH website Summary from release notes: Fix CVE-2025-26465 - ssh in OpenSSH versions 6.8p1 to 9.9p1 contained a logic error that allowed an on-path attacker to impersonate any server when the VerifyHostKeyDNS option is enabled. This option is off by default. Fix CVE-2025-26466 - sshd in OpenSSH versions 9.5p1 to 9.9p1 is vulnerable to a memory/CPU denial-of-service related to the handling of SSH2MSGPING packets. This condition may be mitigated using the existing PerSourcePenalties feature. #OpenSSH #security #CVE

body: I submitted a Pull Request to update MacPorts' OpenSSH to 9.9p2 here: https://github.com/macports/macports-ports/pull/27712 GitHub Continuous Integration checks are running. Hopefully they will be OK (Update 2 out of 3 have completed successfully, which is a good sign). I tested locally without issues, but I also build against LibreSSL locally, whereas GitHub CI and MacPorts' Build Bots I think default to OpenSSL. This release is to address some vulnerabilities identified by Qualys and other less critical bugs. More details from upstream here: https://www.openssh.com/releasenotes.html#9.9p2 Of particular note: " Fix CVE-2025-26465 - ssh(1) in OpenSSH versions 6.8p1 to 9.9p1 (inclusive) contained a logic error that allowed an on-path attacker (a.k.a MITM) to impersonate any server when the VerifyHostKeyDNS option is enabled. This option is off by default. * Fix CVE-2025-26466 - sshd(8) in OpenSSH versions 9.5p1 to 9.9p1 (inclusive) is vulnerable to a memory/CPU denial-of-service related to the handling of SSH2 MSG PING packets. This condition may be mitigated using the existing PerSourcePenalties feature. Both vulnerabilities were discovered and demonstrated to be exploitable by the Qualys Security Advisory team. We thank them for their detailed review of OpenSSH." If I read everything correctly, these vulnerabilities primarily only impact the Portable OpenSSH releases (which is what MacPorts uses). However, OpenBSD has also issued the following errata to mitigate one of the issues as it also appears to impact OpenBSD users: "008: SECURITY FIX: February 18, 2025   All architectures sshd(8) denial of service relating to SSH2 MSG PING handling. ssh(1) server impersonation when VerifyHostKeyDNS enabled. A source code patch exists which remedies this problem." Source code patch for OpenBSD here: https://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/7.6/common/008_ssh.patch.sig Having written as much, it appears as if the main OpenSSH version for OpenBSD is still 9.9, so I am not going to make a submission for undeadly.org Other editors reading this are welcome to though, I just kind of have a lot of other stuff on my plate at present. As usual, I also have too much going on in my life to want more responsibilities such as commit access within MacPorts, so it's up to someone else to merge it. Update  #2 : I also decided to be a good Samaritan and reported the issue to Apple. Not that they have ever acknowledged my efforts for such things nor paid me from their bug bounty program in years of doing similar things. Because, OFC, Apple can't spare a penny to anyone like me. Maybe Qualys already reported it to them anyway (though they would have no obligation to do so, they did find the vulns and reported them upstream as would be expected). #OpenSSH   #MacPorts   #SecureShell   #InfoSec   #Cryptography   #Security   #CVE   #PatchTuesday   #OpenSource   #OpenBSD   #macOS

This option is off by default. Fix CVE-2025-26466 - sshd in OpenSSH versions 9.5p1 to 9.9p1 is vulnerable to a memory/CPU denial-of-service related to the handling of SSH2 MSG PING packets. This condition may be mitigated using the existing PerSourcePenalties feature. Both vulnerabilities were discovered and demonstrated to be exploitable by the Qualys Security Advisory team. A source code patch exists which remedies this problem." Source code patch for OpenBSD here: Having written as much, it appears as if the main OpenSSH version for OpenBSD is still 9.9, so I am not going to make a submission for undeadly.org Other editors reading this are welcome to though, I just kind of have a lot of other stuff on my plate at present. body: An impact summary has now been added to the openssl website: Impact summary: TLS and DTLS connections using raw public keys may be vulnerable to man-in-middle attacks when server authentication failure is not detected by clients. RPKs are disabled by default in both TLS clients and TLS servers. The issue only arises when TLS clients explicitly enable RPK use by the server, and the server, likewise, enables sending of an RPK instead of an X.509 certificate chain. The affected clients are those that then rely on the handshake to fail when the server‚Äôs RPK fails to match one of the expected public keys, by setting the verification mode to SSL_VERIFY_PEER. Clients that enable server-side raw public keys can still find out that raw public key verification failed by calling SSL_get_verify_result(), and those that do, and take appropriate action, are not affected. This issue was introduced in the initial implementation of RPK support in OpenSSL 3.2. The FIPS modules in 3.4, 3.3, 3.2, 3.1 and 3.0 are not affected by this issue. https:// openssl-library.org/news/vulne rabilities/index.html#CVE-2024-12797 # openssl   # threatintel   # vuln   # cve   # cve202412797   # rfc7250
cleaned_body: An impact summary has now been added to the openssl website: Impact summary: TLS and DTLS connections using raw public keys may be vulnerable to man-in-middle attacks when server authentication failure is not detected by clients. RPKs are disabled by default in both TLS clients and TLS servers. The issue only arises when TLS clients explicitly enable RPK use by the server, and the server, likewise, enables sending of an RPK instead of an X.509 certificate chain. The affected clients are those that then rely on the handshake to fail when the server‚Äôs RPK fails to match one of the expected public keys, by setting the verification mode to SSLVERIFYPEER. Clients that enable server-side raw public keys can still find out that raw public key verification failed by calling SSLgetverifyresult, and those that do, and take appropriate action, are not affected. This issue was introduced in the initial implementation of RPK support in OpenSSL 3.2. The FIPS modules in 3.4, 3.3, 3.2, 3.1 and 3.0 are not affected by this issue. https:// openssl-library.org/news/vulne rabilities/index.html#CVE-2024-12797 # openssl # threatintel # vuln # cve # cve202412797 # rfc7250

body: # Apple  Patches 'Extremely Sophisticated Attack' That Can Hit iPhones This patch is an emergency update (18.3.1) from Apple. It fixes an vulnerability where USB Restricted Mode can be disabled on the device. Tracked as CVE-2025-24200 and may have been used by law enforcement. Apple describes the zero day as highly sophisticated attack against a targeted individual. # iphone   # cve   # cybersecurity   # security   # infosec https://www. pcmag.com/news/apple-patches-e xtremely-sophisticated-attack-that-can-hit-iphones

body: Should we release PoCs publicly - after they have been fixed? or should we not? While releasing a PoC is positive for research and awareness, there's no denying it increases the vulnerability's exploitation in the wild. - CVE-2024-41710 fixed on July 17, 2024 - Two weeks later: PoC published on Github - Jan 2025: Aquabot v3 noticed "using a payload almost identical to the PoC" Ref:  https://www. akamai.com/blog/security-resea rch/2025-january-new-aquabot-mirai-variant-exploiting-mitel-phones # botnet   # phone   # entreprise   # mirai   # IoT   # CVE -2024-41710
cleaned_body: Should we release PoCs publicly - after they have been fixed? or should we not? While releasing a PoC is positive for research and awareness, there's no denying it increases the vulnerability's exploitation in the wild. - CVE-2024-41710 fixed on July 17, 2024 - Two weeks later: PoC published on Github - Jan 2025: Aquabot v3 noticed "using a payload almost identical to the PoC" Ref: akamai.com/blog/security-resea rch/2025-january-new-aquabot-mirai-variant-exploiting-mitel-phones # botnet # phone # entreprise # mirai # IoT # CVE -2024-41710

CVE-2024-13484 ‚Äì ArgoCD Cluster-Wide PrometheusRule Injection Vulnerability 

CVE ID : CVE-2024-13484

Published :  Jan. 28, 2025, 6:15 p.m. | 13¬†hours, 44¬†minutes ago

Description : A flaw was found in ArgoCD. The openshift.io/cluster-monitoring label is applied to all namespaces that deploy an ArgoCD CR instance, allowing the namespace to create a rogue PrometheusRule. This issue can have adverse effects on the platform monitoring stack, as the rule is rolled out cluster-wide when the label is applied.

Severity: 8.2 | HIGH

body: 7-Zip fixes bug that bypasses  # Windows  MoTW  # security  warnings, patch now Tracked as CVE-2025-0411. If a user downloads a crafted archive with the Mark of the Web, 7-zip doesn‚Äôt extend the MoTW to the extracted files. This can be exploited to execute arbitrary code. Was fixed on 30 NOV 24. However, 7-zip doesn‚Äôt auto update, so users should double check their installed versions. # cve   # security   # cybersecurity https://www. bleepingcomputer.com/news/secu rity/7-zip-fixes-bug-that-bypasses-the-windows-motw-security-mechanism-patch-now/

CVE-2024-42012 ‚Äì GRau DATA Password Disclosure 

CVE ID : CVE-2024-42012

Published :  Jan. 22, 2025, 4:15 p.m. | 14¬†minutes ago

Description : GRAU DATA Blocky before 3.1 stores passwords encrypted rather than hashed. At the login screen, the user's password is compared to the user's decrypted cleartext password. An attacker with Windows admin or debugging rights can therefore steal the user's Blocky password and from there impersonate that local user.

Severity: 0.0 | NA

body: Interesting approach to CVE allocation: announcing End-of-Life (EOL) versions of Node.js. I haven't notice this practice before. Not entirely sure about the objective. body: For those of you contending with old HP/HPE iLO management consoles, some tools that might interest: https:// github.com/seveas/python-hpilo https:// seveas.github.io/python-hpilo/ https:// github.com/seveas/python-hpilo /blob/master/firmware.conf And the work-around for old iLO2-era gear and the still-latent CVE-2013-4786: https:// support.hpe.com/hpesc/public/d ocDisplay?docId=emr_na-c04197764 How to disable IPMI access from the management processor command menu: MP:CM> sa -lanipmi d # hp   # hpe   # itanium   # ilo   # cve

body: # ESETresearch  discovered and reported to  @ certcc  a vulnerability that allows bypassing UEFI Secure Boot on most UEFI-based systems. This vulnerability,  # CVE -2024-7344, was found by  @ smolar_m  in a UEFI app signed by Microsoft‚Äôs 3rd-party UEFI certificate. The vulnerability is caused by the use of an unsafe PE/COFF-loading mechanism, lacking any Secure Boot-related checks, which allows loading arbitrary (even unsigned) UEFI applications. We reported our findings to CERT/CC in June 2024, who successfully contacted the affected vendors. The issue has now been fixed in these vendors‚Äô products and the old, vulnerable binaries were revoked by Microsoft in the January 14th Patch Tuesday update. Instructions to check whether you‚Äôre affected by this vulnerability and to verify that the necessary revocations have been installed on your system can be found in our blogpost:  https://www. welivesecurity.com/en/eset-res earch/under-cloak-uefi-secure-boot-introducing-cve-2024-7344/
cleaned_body: # ESETresearch discovered and reported to @ certcc a vulnerability that allows bypassing UEFI Secure Boot on most UEFI-based systems. The vulnerability is caused by the use of an unsafe PE/COFF-loading mechanism, lacking any Secure Boot-related checks, which allows loading arbitrary UEFI applications. We reported our findings to CERT/CC in June 2024, who successfully contacted the affected vendors. The issue has now been fixed in these vendors‚Äô products and the old, vulnerable binaries were revoked by Microsoft in the January 14th Patch Tuesday update. Instructions to check whether you‚Äôre affected by this vulnerability and to verify that the necessary revocations have been installed on your system can be found in our blogpost: welivesecurity.com/en/eset-res earch/under-cloak-uefi-secure-boot-introducing-cve-2024-7344/

CVE ID : CVE-2025-21629

Published :  Jan. 15, 2025, 1:15 p.m. | 1¬†hour, 2¬†minutes ago

Description : In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

net: reenable NETIF_F_IPV6_CSUM offload for BIG TCP packets

The blamed commit disabled hardware offoad of IPv6 packets with

extension headers on devices that advertise NETIF_F_IPV6_CSUM,

based on the definition of that feature in skbuff.h:

 *   * - %NETIF_F_IPV6_CSUM

 *     - Driver (device) is only able to checksum [‚Ä¶]

CVE-2024-57903 ‚Äì Linux kernel SO_REUSEPORT Inet Socket Restriction Comic Book Bug 

CVE ID : CVE-2024-57903

Published :  Jan. 15, 2025, 1:15 p.m. | 1¬†hour, 2¬†minutes ago

Description : In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

net: restrict SO_REUSEPORT to inet sockets

After blamed commit, crypto sockets could accidentally be destroyed

from RCU call back, as spotted by zyzbot [1].

Trying to acquire a mutex in RCU callback is not allowed.

Restrict SO_REUSEPORT socket option to inet sockets.

v1 of this patch supported TCP, UDP and SCTP [‚Ä¶]

 https:// whalers.ir/blog/cve-2024-57903 -linux-kernel-so_reuseport-inet-socket-restriction-comic-book-bug/3967/

CVE-2024-57902 ‚Äì Linux Kernel af_packet: VLAN Get TCI Vulnerability 

CVE ID : CVE-2024-57902

Published :  Jan. 15, 2025, 1:15 p.m. | 1¬†hour, 2¬†minutes ago

Description : In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

af_packet: fix vlan_get_tci() vs MSG_PEEK

Blamed commit forgot MSG_PEEK case, allowing a crash [1] as found

by syzbot.

Rework vlan_get_tci() to not touch skb at all,

so that it can be used from many cpus on the same skb.

Add a const qualifier to skb argument.

[1]

skbuff: skb_under_panic: text:ffffffff8a8da482 [‚Ä¶]

Published :  Jan. 8, 2025, 8:15 p.m. | 1¬†hour, 28¬†minutes ago

Description : A vulnerability classified as critical has been found in ZeroWdd myblog 1.0. This affects an unknown part of the file src/main/java/com/wdd/myblog/config/MyBlogMvcConfig.java. CVE-2025-22141 ‚Äì WeGIA Web Manager SQL Injection Vulnerability 

CVE ID : CVE-2025-22141

Published :  Jan. 8, 2025, 7:15 p.m. | 2¬†hours, 28¬†minutes ago

Description : WeGIA is a web manager for charitable institutions. A SQL Injection vulnerability was identified in the /dao/verificar_recursos_cargo.php endpoint, specifically in the cargo parameter. This vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands, compromising the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the database. This vulnerability is fixed in 3.2.8.

Severity: 0.0 | [‚Ä¶]

body: https:// talosintelligence.com/vulnerab ility_reports/TALOS-2024-2093 CVE-2024-49576: Foxit Reader Use-after-free # threatintel   # Foxit   # cve A specially crafted Javascript code inside a malicious PDF document can trigger this vulnerability, which can lead to memory corruption and result in arbitrary code execution. An attacker needs to trick the user into opening the malicious file to trigger this vulnerability. Exploitation is also possible if a user visits a specially crafted, malicious site if the browser plugin extension is enabled.

cleaned_body: Firewall # Sophos: 3 # Critical Vulnerabilites CONDUCTED CVE-2024-12727 An injection vulnerability SQL Pre-authentication in the Email Protection Functionality. Impact: Risk of remote code execution if certain specific configurations are in place. Discovery: reported by an external researcher via the Bug Bounty Sophos program. CVE-2024-12728 A SSH password suggested and non-profit for the initialization of HA clusters can remain active after deployment. Impact: exposure of a privileged system account if SSH is activated. Discovery: internal detection by Sophos. CVE-2024-12729 Post-authentication code injection via the user portal. Impact: Authenticated users can run remote code. Discovery: reported by an external researcher via the Bug Bounty Sophos program. Correctives and recommendations: Hotfixes available: automatically applied if the automatic installation option is activated. Assigned versions: Sophos Firewall V21.0 GA and previous versions. Remediation: Make sure you use an corrected version or update to the latest compatible version. Protective measurements: Disable WAN access to the user portal and to Webadmin: Use VPN or Central Sophos for remote management. Restriculate SSH access: Limit dedicated HA ports, physically separate. Reconfigure ha with a random and long enough pass. "Sophos has not observed these vulnerability to be exploited at this time." sophos.com/en-us/security-advi sories/sophos-sa-20241219-sfos-dre # cyberveille # cve20241272727 # cve202412728 # cve -2024-12729

cleaned_body: Remote Code Execution in Widget Options-CVE-2024-8672 November 28, 2024 in the Widget Options plugin for WordPress, which is installed on more than 100,000 sites, a critical vulnerability with CVSS 9.9 was revealed. Vulnerability allows you to perform remote execution of harmful code. Consider the process of installing a vulnerable version of the plugin, as well as an example of the operation of vaulting. https: // habr.com/ru/articles/867684/ # Remotecodeexecitation # rse # WordPressplugins # CVE # VulneraBILITY

cleaned_body: Remote Code Execution in WP Umbrella WordPress Plagin in the popular WordPress-WP Umbrella plugin, a critical vulnerability was found for more than 30,000 sites. This drawback, which received the CVE-2024-12209 identifier, can allow unauthorized attackers to completely seize control of vulnerable sites. Vulnerability has an estimate of 9.8 points in CVSS. https: // habr.com/ru/articles/867382/ # rse # lfi # wordpress # cve202412209 # wpumbrella # plugin

Linux LPE through Needrestart on November 19, 2024, Qualys publicly disclosed information about the five vulnerabilities in the Needrestart utility. These vulnerability relate to the local escalation of privileges and were found in a binary file. CVE-2024-48990 affects the versions of Needrestart to 3.8. In Ubuntu, it is used by default from version 21.04. The problem is also relevant for Debian, Fedora and other Linux distributions. LPE allows the attacker to increase his privileges in the system, gaining access to actions available only to administrators. This can be used to install malicious software, control of the system, bypassing security restrictions and access to confidential data. The main goal is to get full control over the system. Vulnerability has an estimate of 7.8 points in CVSS. https: // habr.com/ru/articles/866582/ # linux # lpe # Needrestart # CVE # 2024

body: Apparently I am getting one more  # CVE   this year, and this one is kind of cool :) Earlier this year, I found a critical vulnerability in the Microsoft Update Catalog ( https:// catalog.update.microsoft.com  ). This is the site where you go to download individual update packages for Microsoft products. I  # redteam  for  # microsoft   and I pulled off that exploit as part of my normal work. Previously Microsoft hasn't issued CVE's for service vulnerabilities, but now as part of the expanded Secure Future Initiative, critical vulnerabilities in Microsoft service get CVE's. I think 9.3/8.4 is the highest CVSS I've ever gotten. This is a "no action" CVE, because there's nothing for you do to make yourself safer. Microsoft already patched the service. I don't know if I can say more about the exploit than what's in the official disclosure. You can read that here: https:// msrc.microsoft.com/update-guid e/vulnerability/CVE-2024-49147 # cve_2024_49147

cleaned_body: Remote Code Execution through SQL injection in Zabbix on November 27, 2024 revealed a critical vulnerability to Zabbix with CVSS-assessment 9.9, which is a SQL-injecting in one of the API Zabbix API Endpoins. Vulnerability allows an attacking access to the API to perform arbitrary SQL queries. With certain Zabbix settings, which allow the remote execution of commands through agents, this vulnerability can be used to fully compromise the infrastructure under the Zabbix monitoring. https: // habr.com/ru/articles/865828/ # rse # sqli # zabbix # Pentest # Cve

body: # OpenWrt  Sysupgrade flaw let  # hackers  push malicious firmware images This was discovered by security researcher "RyotaK," tracked as CVE-2024-54143, was fixed within hours by OpenWRT developers. A vulnerability in how the input handling mechanism could allow arbitrary command injection. No evidence of exploitation by threat actors according to OpenWRT (though, this scope is only limited to builds no older than 7 days), but users are encouraged to perform checks to ensure their firmware isn't malicious. # cve   # cybersecurity   # infosec https://www. bleepingcomputer.com/news/secu rity/openwrt-sysupgrade-flaw-let-hackers-push-malicious-firmware-images/

body: Ever wondered what happens to rejected CVEs that still appear in other sources? body: Unfixed Arbitrary Code Execution in Emacs! In elisp-mode.el in GNU Emacs through 30.0.92, a user who chooses to invoke elisp-completion-at-point (for code completion) on untrusted Emacs Lisp source code can trigger unsafe Lisp macro expansion that allows attackers to execute arbitrary code. (This unsafe expansion also occurs if a user chooses to enable on-the-fly diagnosis that byte compiles untrusted Emacs Lisp source code.) https:// nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2 024-53920 # emacs   # elisp   # emacslisp   # cve
cleaned_body: Unfixed Arbitrary Code Execution in Emacs! Analysis of vulnerabilities CVE-2024-24401 and CVE-2024-24402 in Nagios XI Preface Hello everyone, my name is Dmitry, I work as a specialist in the modeling of attacks in the company "Prospective Monitoring". I am developing attack scenarios for the ampire cyber polygon. When the team and I are testing current vulnerabilities, the process looks like this: we set the vulnerable version of the software, check the performance of Proof of Concept, after which we are updated to the current version and convinced that the vulnerability is eliminated. Testing the relevant vulnerabilities in the monitoring system Nagios XI, I found that there is very little information on the vulnerabilities of the CVE-2024-24401 and CVE-2024-24402. In addition, it turned out that one of the vulnerabilities, namely, the vulnerability of the local increase in privileges of the CVE-2024-24402, was not completely crushed. https: // habr.com/ru/companies/pm/artic les/861122/ # Study of programs # Information Security # InformationSecurity # CVE # NAGIOSXI # RCE # LPE # SQLINJECTION # hacking

body: On a less ominous note, just got what's likely to be my only  # CVE  this year:  https://www. cve.org/cverecord?id=CVE-2024- 9110 That's a reflected  # XSS  in  # BeyondTrust  Privileged Identity Manager (PIM), a password vaulting tool. The product is EOL next year, so you probably shouldn't be using it anyway. But if you catch someone with that XSS who has a valid cookie, you can exfiltrate everything in the vault they have access to via XHR.

body: The responsible disclosure process wasn't the smoothest I've ever had, but in the end we got this fixed, and that's what matters.  This issue is very similar to  # CVE -2024-47874 in  # Starlette  ( # FastAPI ), which was fixed a lot quicker and with a lot less back and forth. I really have to give creds to the Starlette team here. Great work! It was really nice to work with you. https:// nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2 024-47874 # infosec

body: Fixes for  # CVE -2024-49767 were released, so I guess we can talk about the issue now. If you are running  # flask  or other  # werkzeug  based applications, please upgrade. Long story short: It was possible to fill the entire memory on a server and cause OOM crashes with a single multipart form submission request. There was a configurable limit that should prevent that, but it did not actually do anything and was also off by default. https:// nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2 024-49767 https:// github.com/pallets/werkzeug/is sues/2964 # infosec

cleaned_body: Analysis of the vulnerability of the CVE-2024-38227 in Microsoft Sharepoint on September 10, Microsoft has released another selection of updates, eliminating 79 vulnerabilities in various products. Our attention was attracted by patches for Microsoft SharePoint - an extensive system with sites management functions. Of the five vulnerabilities included in the September issue, four allowed to execute third -party code, one created a threat of DOS. We have chosen for the analysis CVE-2024-38227-RCE-vulnerability of a privileged user. For us, such a study is an opportunity to study Microsoft SharePoint and understand the current theory of its operation. Analysis of CVE-2024-43044-from reading files to remote code execution in Jenkins through agents, the introduction of Jenkins is a widely used tool to automate tasks, such as assembling, testing and developing software. It is an important part of the development process in many organizations. If an attacker gets access to the Jenkins server, this can lead to serious consequences, such as theft of accounting data, manipulations with code or even disruption of deployment processes. Access to Jenkins provides an attacker with the opportunity to intervene in a software conveyor, which can lead to chaos in the process of developing and compromising confidential data. In this article, we will consider the advisory conclusion on the vulnerability of the CVE-2024-43044, which is a vulnerability associated with arbitrary reading of files in Jenkins. We will show how to use this vulnerability to escalate privileges in order to achieve remote code execution on the jenkins controller when capturing the Jenkins agent. Jenkins architecture overview Jenkins is based on the "Controller-Agents" model, where the Jenkins controller is the main knot in the Jenkins installation. The controller manages Jenkins agents and coordinates their work, including planning tasks on agents and monitoring their condition. The interaction between the controller and agents can occur through the Inbound connection or SSH. https: // habr.com/ru/articles/850248/ # CVE # RCE # JENKINS

body: Researcher reveals ‚Äòcatastrophic‚Äô  # security  flaw in the Arc browser (CVE-2024-45489) The Arc Browser is a fork of  # chromium  with a lot of built-in features and integrations... and requires an account to use. Arc Browser uses Firebase to store user information for features like Arc Boosts. Arc Boosts can contain arbitrary javascript... with knowing the CreatorID, an attacker could inject code into other users' browsing sessions. Crazy to me because this implementation appeared to rely solely on user-provided identities (the CreatorID) without implementing any checks. They've fixed the issue and are apparently implementing mitigations + moving off Firebase for "future features." # browsers   # cybersecurity   # cve https://www. theverge.com/2024/9/20/2424991 9/arc-browser-boost-firebase-vulnerability-patched

body: Critical Kibana Vulnerability - Arbitrary Code Execution via YAML Deserialization Date : September 5, 2024 CVE : CVE-2024-37285 Vulnerability Type : Deserialization of Untrusted Data CWE : [[CWE-502]] Sources :  Elastic Security Advisory Synopsis CVE-2024-37285 impacts Kibana versions 8.10.0 to 8.15.0, where a deserialization flaw allows remote code execution if an attacker injects malicious YAML payloads. This vulnerability requires that an attacker has elevated Elasticsearch and Kibana privileges. Issue Summary The vulnerability arises from improper YAML deserialization within Kibana. A malicious actor can craft a YAML payload and execute arbitrary code, provided they have specific Elasticsearch index and Kibana privileges. This issue affects Kibana from versions 8.10.0 through 8.15.0 and is critical due to its ease of exploitation and the potential for widespread impact. Technical Key Findings Attackers exploit this flaw by submitting a specially crafted YAML document that Kibana deserializes without proper validation. Once the malicious code is parsed, it can run on the server with elevated privileges, enabling arbitrary code execution.  The attacker must have the following Elasticsearch indices permissions;  write  access to system indices¬† .kibana_ingest* The¬† allow_restricted_indices ¬†flag needs to be set to¬† true The attacker must also have ANY of the following Kibana privileges;  Under¬† Fleet ¬†the¬† All ¬†privilege is granted Under¬† Integration ¬†the¬† Read ¬†or¬† All ¬†privilege is granted Access to the¬† fleet-setup ¬†privilege is gained through the Fleet Server‚Äôs service account token## Vulnerable Products Kibana versions 8.10.0 to 8.15.0. Impact Assessment Successful exploitation could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands, leading to a complete system compromise. This could affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability, making it a high-risk issue for organizations relying on Kibana for data visualization and exploration. Patches or Workaround Upgrading to Kibana version 8.15.1 resolves this vulnerability. Additionally, limiting access to Elasticsearch indices and restricting Kibana privileges reduces exposure. Tags # CVE -2024-37285  # Kibana   # ArbitraryCodeExecution   # YAML   # Deserialization   # ElasticStack   # CyberSecurity
cleaned_body: Critical Kibana Vulnerability - Arbitrary Code Execution via YAML Deserialization Date : September 5, 2024 CVE : CVE-2024-37285 Vulnerability Type : Deserialization of Untrusted Data CWE : ] Sources : Elastic Security Advisory Synopsis CVE-2024-37285 impacts Kibana versions 8.10.0 to 8.15.0, where a deserialization flaw allows remote code execution if an attacker injects malicious YAML payloads. This vulnerability requires that an attacker has elevated Elasticsearch and Kibana privileges. Issue Summary The vulnerability arises from improper YAML deserialization within Kibana. A malicious actor can craft a YAML payload and execute arbitrary code, provided they have specific Elasticsearch index and Kibana privileges. This issue affects Kibana from versions 8.10.0 through 8.15.0 and is critical due to its ease of exploitation and the potential for widespread impact. Technical Key Findings Attackers exploit this flaw by submitting a specially crafted YAML document that Kibana deserializes without proper validation. Once the malicious code is parsed, it can run on the server with elevated privileges, enabling arbitrary code execution. The attacker must have the following Elasticsearch indices permissions; write access to system indices .kibanaingest The allowrestrictedindices flag needs to be set to true The attacker must also have ANY of the following Kibana privileges; Under Fleet the All privilege is granted Under Integration the Read or All privilege is granted Access to the fleet-setup privilege is gained through the Fleet Server‚Äôs service account token## Vulnerable Products Kibana versions 8.10.0 to 8.15.0. Impact Assessment Successful exploitation could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands, leading to a complete system compromise. This could affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability, making it a high-risk issue for organizations relying on Kibana for data visualization and exploration. Patches or Workaround Upgrading to Kibana version 8.15.1 resolves this vulnerability. Additionally, limiting access to Elasticsearch indices and restricting Kibana privileges reduces exposure. Tags # CVE -2024-37285 # Kibana # ArbitraryCodeExecution # YAML # Deserialization # ElasticStack # CyberSecurity
